THE CONDUCTOR JUMPED FROM THE TRAIN BEFORE THE IMPACTAND SUSTAINED INJURIES TO HIS RIGHT LEG.  THE FURL TRUCK EXPLODED AND THE LOCOMOTIVE STARTED ON FIRE. GATX 203087 DERAILED WHEN THE CARS WERE BEING PULLED ACCOUNT THE WHEEL BECAME DECOMPRESSED FROM THE HEAT OF THE FIRE. THE ACTIVATED CROSSING PROTECTION WAS DESTROYED AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES  TEMPORARILY EVACUATED APPROXIMATELY 200 PEOPLE FROM THE AREA.  APPROXIMATELY 7,200GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL WERE LOST FROM FUEL TRUCK.

AFTER SWITCHING THEIR SPOT CARS THEY COUPLED THE TRACK AND WERE SHOVING TO CARGILL CORN MILLING.  THE CREW WENTTO PROTECT THE CROSSING APPROXIMATELY 10 CARS LENGTHS AWAY AND FAILED TO PROTECT THEIR MOVEMENT ON THE LEAD.  THEY WERE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE CROSSING WHILE THE EAST SIDE OF THE CARS BEING SHOVED CORNERED CARS NS 254022.  THE CONDUCTOR CLAIMS RESPONSIBILITY, AND WAS REASONABLE CAUSED TESTED. I0507-d-03-28-07-PATH.Accident Cause: Failure to comply with restricted speed or its equivalent not in connection with a block or interloc
I0507-d-03-28-07-PATH.Narrative:
AT 6:43PM THE CONDUCTOR REPORTED THAT THE TRAIN LEAVING HOBOKEN TO 33RD ST LOST POWER AND CAUSED A SMOKE CONDITION.  AFTER INSPECTING THE TRAIN.  INSPECTION OF THE AREA REVEALED THAT CAR 134, THE 4THOF A 7-CAR CONSIST (849-860-629-134-733-892-806) DERAILED IN CAISSON 2 LOWER, APPROXIMATELY 20 FT. PASSED SIGNAL 111Z. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE TRAIN CAR BODY EXTERIOR, SIGNAL CABLES, PROTECTION BOARDAND THIRD RAIL.  PAPD AND A RESCUE CREW RESPONDED. NO INJURIES REPORTED.  JERSEY CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED, BUT WAS NOT NEEDED.  CAR 134 WAS RE-RAILED BY 10:41.  ALCOHOL AND DRUG TESTING OF THE TRAIN CREW YIELDED NEGATIVE RESULTS.  DAMAGES TOTALED $17,566.

A SLOW SPEED ORDER OF 5 MPH WAS IMMEDIATELY IMPLEMENTED.  ADDITIONAL ACTIONS INCLUDED THE ADJUSTING SIGNAL TIMING, IMPLEMENTATION OF RAIL LUBRICATOR MAINTENANCE RECORDS AND THE REMOVAL OF 16 FT. 3/4 IN. OF THIRD RAIL.  THE INVESTIGATION IS ON-GOING.

00718-d-03-05-07-TRRA.Narrative: FOREMAN ON Y325 WAS PROTECTING SHOVE MOVEMENT ON NS A & E MAIN.  SWITCH FOREMAN FAILED TO ALIGN SWITCH ON CONNECTION TO VC BELT.  SWITCH FOREMAN SHOVED CARS ONTO VC BELT WITHOUT AUTHORITY TO OCCUPY THE TRACK.  THE FOREMAN WAS NOT FAMILIAR WITH THE AREA.  SWITCH WAS LEFT OPEN ON THE A & E CONNECTIONTRACK TO THE VC BELT.  EMPLOYEE CONTINUED TO SHOVE ONTO A & E CONNECTION TRACK AND RUN THROUGH THE SWITCH ON THE VC BELT.  AFTER SHOVING ENOUGH FOR LOCOMOTIVE HEAD ROOM, MOVEMENT STOPPED AND SWITCH FOREMAN WALKED TO BEND ROAD AND CABBED TO THE HEAD OF THE TRAIN.  THE TRAIN WAS OPERATING TO WIGGINS 2YARD.  AFTER ARRIVING AT WIGGINS 2 YARD, EMPLOYEES NOTICED THAT THE 10 REAR CARS WERE NOT ON THE TRAIN.  THE SWITCH FOREMAN NOTIFIED THE YARDMASTER THAT SOMEONE MAY HAVE PULLED THE PIN ON THE REAR TEN CARS.  AFTER THE TRAINMASTER INSPECTED THE AREA, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE CREW RAN THROUGH THE SWITCH AND PULLED BACK THROUGH THE SWITCH AND DERAILED.

I0407-d-03-25-07-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Investigation complete, cause could not be determined (When using this code, the narrative must incl
I0407-d-03-25-07-PATH.Accident Cause: Investigation complete, cause could not be determined (When using this code, the narrative must incl
I0407-d-03-25-07-PATH.Narrative: AT 2:52PM, A SEVEN CAR (710-177-101-728-617-174-850) PASSENGER TRAIN WAS TRAVELLING FROM JSQ TO HOBOKEN AND 33RD ST STATIONS, WHEN THE FIFTH CAR (617) DERAILED IN CAISSON 2 LOWER, NEAR SIGNAL R20 IN TUNNEL B. CAR 617, #2 END STRUCK THE SIDE OF THE TUNNEL WALL CAUSING EXTERIOR DAMAGE TO THE CAR BODYFLANGE, GUARDRAIL. THIRD RAIL AND PROTECTIVE BOARD, WITH MINOR DAMAGE TO THE BENCHWALL.  THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELLING AT AN ESTIMATED 11.36 MPH IN AN 8 MPH CURVED AREA. THE CONDUCTOR WAS IN THE PROCESS OFINSPECTING THE TRAIN FOR A PULLED EMERGENCY BRAKE, WHEN THE CONTROL CENTER CALLED AND ADVISED THATA POWER SECTION HAD BLOWN. THE CONDUCTOR INSPECTED THE AREA BETWEEN THE 5TH AND 6TH CARS AS INSTRUCTED AND FOUND DAMAGED PROTECTION BOARD, THEN REALIZED A DERAILMENT OCCURRED. THE CONDUCTOR, ENGINEERAND 300 PASSENGERS WERE ON BOARD THE TRAIN, WITH THREE PASSENGERS REPORTING INJURIES. POLICE PERSONNEL AND A RESCUE CREW RESPONDED TO THE SCENE, EVACUATED AND TRANSPORTED THE PASSENGERS TO HOBOKEN. RAIL CAR#1243 RE-RAILED CAR 617 BY 8:00PM AND TAKEN TO THE HARRISON CAR MAINTENANCE FACILITY TO BE INSPECTED AND REPAIRED. THE UTV BEGAN REPAIRS ON 20 FEET OF COVER BOARD AND CONTACT RAIL.  SERVICE WASMAINTAINED BY RUNNING THE UPTOWN TRAINS DIRECTLY TO 33RD BYPASSING HOBOKEN AND HAVING PASSENGERS CHANGE AT OTHER STATIONS TO GET TO HOBOKEN.  THE TRAIN CREW WAS TESTED AND YIELDED NEGATIVE RESULTS FORALCOHOL AND DRUGS.  DAMAGES TOTALLED $38640.  THE FINAL ANALYSIS REVEALED A COMBINATION OF FACTORS

548474-d-03-07-07-IC.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure engine(s) (railroad employee)
548474-d-03-07-07-IC.Narrative: R95491-07 HAD UNCOUPLED LOCOMOTIVES FROM THE EAST END OF THEIR TRAIN IN PREPARATION TO RUNNING THE UNITS AROUND THEIR TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER BEGAN THE PROCEDURE TO CHANGE OPERATING ENDS OF THE TWO-LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST BY PLACING THE MU-2A BRAKE VALVE ON THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE, UP  6522.  IN "TRAIL" POSITION THE CREW THEN DECIDED TO PICK UP FOOD AT A NEARBY RESTAURANT BEFORE COMPLETING THE PROCEDURE.  THIS LEFT THE MU-2A BRAKE VALVE ON BOTH UNITS IN "TRAIL" POSITION, WHICH PERMITTED THE BRAKES TO SLOWLYRELEASED WHILE THE CREW WAS IN THE RESTAURANT.  THE CREW ALSO FAILED TO APPLY THE HANDBRAKES ON EITHER LOCOMOTIVE BEFORE LEAVING THEM UNATTENDED.  WHEN THE BRAKE RELEASED, THE LOCOMOTIVE ROLLED DOWNGRADE, ENTERED AMTRAK TRACKAGE AND COLLIDED WITH METRA COMMUTER TRAIN #839 SHORTLY AFTER IT DEPARTEDCHICAGO UNION STATION.  THE COLLISION DERAILED THE LEAD TRUCK OF THE STRIKING LOCOMOTIVE, UP 6522, AND THE  LEAD TRUCK OF THE UNOCCUPIED HEAD COACH OF THE METRA TRAIN.  METRA TRAIN #839 WAS CARRYING 55 PASSENGERS AND 3  METRA EMPLOYEES.  FIVE PASSENGERS AND TWO EMPLOYEES WERE TREATED FOR MINOR INJURIES.
548474-d-03-07-07-IC.Other Parent Railroad Company Name: NORTHEAST ILLINOIS REGIONAL COMMUTER RAIL CORP. -- METRA

200699-d-03-11-07-SOO.Narrative: 198-06 TRAVELING EAST ON #1 MAIN (NS LAKE DIVISION, DETROIT DISTRICT, MP 16.9, CP PRESTON) THE #3 TRACTION MOTOR OF LEAD LOCOMOTIVE (CP 8531) CAUGHT FIRE & FILLED CAB WITH SMOKE. TRAIN WAS STOPPED ATPRESTON SO CREW COULD GET FRESH AIR.  CREW DECLINED IMMEDIATE MEDICAL ATTENTION THOUGH NOT FEELING WELL, REQUESTED TO BE TRANSPORTED TO HOSPTIAL UPON ARRIVAL AT ELKHART, WHERE THEY WERE TREATED FOR SMOKE INHALATION. NS CONTACTED & ADVISED SOO WOULD BE REPORTING VIA FORM 54. NO NS TRACK DAMAGE. NS ADVISED INCIDENT NUMBER ON 4/26  AS 028902 AFTER SOO MONTHLY REPORTING HAD ALREADY BEEN SUBMITTED. ON5/27/07 NS ADVISED "REPORT #028902 WAS INADVERTENTLY DELETED FROM OUR SYSTEM & HAD TO BE RE-ENTERED.THE CORRECT REPORT NUMBER IS #028950."

ON 4/17/07 RECEIVED INFORMATION FROM SOO ES THAT THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS AT A SWITCH THAT IS MAINTAINED BY METRA WITH SURROUNDING TRACK BEING MAINTAINED BY SOO. METRA ADVISES THEIR INCIDENT NUMBER IS MRA0077 WITH $700.00 DAMAGES TO THE SWITCH.
